page.title: 07NATURE RESERVE
page.content: IN A SAMPLE OF EIGHT SILVER BIRCH TREES IN THE NATURE RESERVE AT FRESHFIELD THE CIRCUMFERENCE VARIED FROM 20CM TO 65CM. ALL BUT TWO OF THE TREES HAD A CIRCUMFERENCE OF 40CM OR MORE. THE DISTANCE BETWEEN NEIGHBOURING TREES VARIED BETWEEN 60CM AND 335CM. ONLY ONE PAIR OF TREES WAS SEPARATED BY A DISTANCE OF MORE THAN 160CM AND THREE PAIRS WERE SEPARATED BY A DISTANCE OF 80CM OR LESS. IN A SQUARE METRE AROUND AN OLD TREE STUMP WE FOUND TWO SMALL PIECES OF PAPER, MOSS, TREE BARK, THE REMAINS OF A PINE CONE, PINE NEEDLE CLUSTERS, GRASS, A MONEY SPIDER, TWIGS AND WOODLICE. THE PAPER AND THE CHOPPED DOWN TREE WERE EVIDENCE OF HUMAN ACTIVITY AND THE PINE CONE REMAINS SHOWED THAT SQUIRRELS HAD BEEN BUSY.
